skill.name: algorithmic-art
skill.description: Create generative art using p5.js with seeded randomness. Use this when creating procedural art, interactive visualizations, or algorithmic designs.
skill.summary: Create generative art using p5.js with seeded randomness. Use this when creating procedural art, int...
skill.author: Doyajin174

security_audit.summary: This skill contains only documentation and examples for creating generative art with p5.js. It has no executable code, network calls, or file operations. The content is purely educational and provides HTML/JavaScript templates for artistic creation.

content.value_statement: Transform mathematical concepts into stunning visual art. This skill guides you through creating algorithmic artwork with seeded randomness for reproducible, shareable designs.
actual_capabilities: Generate p5.js code for algorithmic art
Create reproducible artwork with seeded randomness
Build interactive HTML viewers with sidebar controls
Export artwork as PNG or SVG files
Implement particle systems and noise fields
limitations: Requires p5.js library loaded from CDN

use_cases.title: Create Unique Artwork
use_cases.description: Generate one-of-a-kind visual pieces using mathematical algorithms and randomness patterns.

use_cases.title: Build Interactive Visualizations
use_cases.description: Create data visualizations and interactive art installations with customizable parameters.

use_cases.title: Prototype Generative Patterns
use_cases.description: Quickly prototype and iterate on procedural patterns for textiles, wallpapers, or branding.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Generative Pattern
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a generative art piece using p5.js with flowing particle patterns. Include seeded randomness for reproducibility and a sidebar with speed and density controls.

prompt_templates.title: Organic Flow Fields
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate an HTML viewer with Perlin noise field visualization. Particles should follow the noise flow, creating organic turbulence patterns. Add controls for noise scale and particle count.

prompt_templates.title: Geometric Abstractions
prompt_templates.prompt: Create algorithmic art based on Fibonacci sequences and golden ratios. Implement recursive geometric patterns with color gradients and parameter controls for complexity levels.

prompt_templates.title: Interactive Particle System
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a complex particle system with attraction/repulsion forces, trail effects, and mouse interaction. Include multiple emission sources and physics parameter controls.

output_examples.input: Create a generative art piece called 'Cosmic Dust' with swirling particle patterns
output: HTML file with embedded p5.js sketch
Sidebar controls for particle count, speed, and color mode
Download buttons for PNG and SVG export
Responsive canvas that adapts to window size

best_practices: Always use seeded random functions for reproducible artwork
Implement windowResized() for responsive canvas behavior
anti_patterns: Using Math.random() instead of seeded random functions
Creating infinite loops without proper exit conditions
Forgetting to implement download functionality for artwork

faq.question: Is this compatible with all modern browsers?
faq.answer: Yes, p5.js works in all modern browsers. The generated HTML includes necessary CDN links.

faq.question: What's the maximum canvas size I can use?
faq.answer: Canvas size is limited by browser memory. For best performance, keep dimensions under 2000x2000 pixels.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my existing web project?
faq.answer: Yes, the generated HTML is self-contained and can be embedded or modified for integration.

faq.question: Is my artwork data safe and private?
faq.answer: All generation happens locally in your browser. No artwork data is sent to external servers.

faq.question: Why is my animation running slowly?
faq.answer: Reduce particle count or complexity. Use requestAnimationFrame and optimize drawing loops.

faq.question: How does this compare to Processing?
faq.answer: p5.js is the JavaScript version of Processing, designed for web browsers with similar syntax and concepts.
